contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Zygmunt Łempicki''' (b. May 11, 1886 in [[Sanok]] - June 21, 1943 in [[Auschwitz]]) was a [[Poland|Polish]] literature theoretician, Germanist, philosopher, and culture historian. Łempicki was professor at the [[Warsaw University]] from 1919 until 1939, member of the [[Polish Academy of Skills]] and editor-in-chief of the "Świat i Życie" encyclopedia. He was arrested and killed in the [[Nazi]] [[concentration camp]] [[Auschwitz]]. ==Works== * ''Geschichte der deutschen Literaturwissenschaft...'' (1920) * ''Renesans - oświecenie - romantyzm'' (1923) * ''Wybór pism'' (t. 1-2 1966) {{Authority control|VIAF=42600959}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Lempicki, Zygmunt | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 11, 1886 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Sanok | DATE OF DEATH = June 21, 1943 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lempicki, Zygmunt}} [[Category:Polish people executed at Auschwitz concentration camp]] [[Category:Historians who died in Nazi concentration camps]] [[Category:Polish historians]] [[Category:Polish philosophers]] [[Category:1886 births]] [[Category:1943 deaths]] [[Category:Polish civilians killed in World War II]] [[Category:People from Sanok]] [[Category:Philosophers who died in Nazi concentration camps]] {{Poland-philosopher-stub}} {{Poland-historian-stub}}
